articleContent.title: Chord: Minor 7th in F (Shape: A)
articleContent.content:
## Brief Presentation
The Minor 7th chord in F with the A shape is a commonly used chord voicing on the guitar. It consists of the notes F, A, C, and Eb. This chord has a melancholic and jazzy sound, often used to add color and depth to music.

## Notes and Intervals
- F: Root
- A: Minor 3rd
- C: Perfect 5th
- Eb: Minor 7th

## Musical Flavor and Applications
The Minor 7th chord in F with the A shape is frequently used in jazz, blues, funk, and R&B genres. Its soulful and mellow characteristics make it a favorite among musicians looking to create a laid-back and emotive atmosphere in their music.

## Songs
1. *"Fly Me to the Moon"* by Frank Sinatra
2. *"No Woman, No Cry"* by Bob Marley
3. *"So What"* by Miles Davis
